meanings.definition: To build or make a nest.
meanings.sent1: The birds were nidating in the tree outside my window.
meanings.sent2: The robin was nidating in the bushes, gathering twigs for its nest.
meanings.sent3: I tried nidating with sticks and leaves to make a tiny nest for my toy bird.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were nidating like birds, flitting from one idea to the next.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel was nidating furiously, creating a cozy home in the hollow tree.

meanings.definition: The act of constructing a nest.
meanings.sent1: The nidating of the sparrows in the park was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: Observing the nidating of the swallows was a peaceful experience.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be birds, engaging in nidating play with twigs and grass.
meanings.sent4: The nidating of the ants in the garden was like a bustling construction site.
meanings.sent5: The intricate nidating of the weaver bird amazed all who watched.
